9761.name: Port Walk
description: The scaffold walk connects intersections here.  Through the spaces
between the timbers, one can see the ground below: a torn up street
that was once Guild Street.  A strong breeze kicks up a cloud of dust
and all around you the people shield their faces from the sands.  Port
Walk continues north and south from here.

9813.name: {BAbove {&[ {CDock --{ME{C-- {&]{B at {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: You stand on the dock. It extends out into the blue
Sea of Swords. Merchants, Captains, Sailors and all
diffrent types of people walk here. Crates float overhead
from large pulleys and onto the harbor road. People fish
off the end of the docks.

9634.name: Tournament and Practice Yard
description: This is a wide expanse of grass filled with dummies, punching bags and
swordpupils. To the north you see a man dressed in black robes, unlike
his iron clad comrades, who you assume to be your master.
You see the grass near the base of the wall here is slightly torn.

9749.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river slows as it widens and meanders through the lowlands. A
small dock give access to the north shore.

9591.name: Dark Passage
description: The small passage ends here for no apparent reason. Looking around you
find a small ladder half buried in the dirt. setting it up you find a
trap door in the ceiling. The passage continues west from here.
Moving closer you see this fire is actually FROZEN in place. The
flames still radiate heat, but are not actually burning. Looking
around you notice a small hole about the size of a piece of charcoal
at the base of the flames.

9745.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues here east to west.  There is a landing area to the
north where you can gain access to the shore.

9842.name: Dark Passage
description: The tunnel continues you west and east.  Hopefully you have a good sense
of direction.

9811.name: Boat Launch To River
description: You stand in the middle of two large iron rails. You see
the rails go straight into the Ishtar River. Slightly to
the east is the delta and the Sea of Swords. Some ship
builders stand at the end of the docks, smoking a pipe.

9858.name: Before the {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RC{rargo {RC{rourier{x
description: Newly constructed over the ocean itself stands the New Thalos Cargo
Courier.  To the east stands the large iron gates which leads into
this small facility.  From inside a couple of airships can be seen
parked at the loading docks.  To the west is the main gate of the New
Thalos Harbor.

9527.name: East Main Street
description: Here on East Main, you smell the odor of freshly slaughtered meat and
hear the pounding of new metal from the armory.  The Square is to
the west and a junction is to the East.

9809.name: Warehouse
description: You walk into a large building. Everywhere you see lumber
and barrels. You see in one corner a table, with four ship-
builders sitting at it, playing cards. The look at you
with whickedness. One takes a slug of whiskey from
his bottle and returns to his cards.

9850.name: Port Walk
description: The northern part of Port Street begins here and rises up an
incline above to the airship complex that accentuates the northeastern
part of the city.  The ramp rises up above the modest rooftops into a
large half-covered structure of thick timbers and metal.  This port
for many signifies times of change, and to some it is disliked and
seen as a threat to their way of life.

9622.name: Butchery
description: This shop has the aroma of freshly slaughterd beasts.  You feel right at home.
You see a fairly simple set up.  The corpses..er...selections hang on hooks,
still bleeding into catch pans that drain into a single underground vat.
You wonder where that leads....  Taped to the counter, almost obscured by
blood, there is a barely readable sign.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much an item is worth
SELL : sells an item to Butch for a generous sum
BUY : Butch's FAVORITE command lets you have an item for his low low price.
NEWBEE INTRUCTOR COMMITEE
You think you hear noises from the vat....nah.

9764.name: Alley
description: The darkness of this alley is almost supernatural.  Deep, black
darkness hints at the alley continuing east and north, while on the
ground feels to be a grating of some kind.

9795.name: {R<{r<{R- {*T{&he {ME{mast {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {*P{&ier {R-{r>{R>{x
description: The eastern extension of the New Thalos Pier stretches eastwards
out into the Sea of Swords.  To the north a flight of stairs leads
down to the sandy shoreline heading north underneath the Northern
Pier.  Southwards the shoreline is missing, only to be replaced with
the Port of New Thalos, a major hub of trade activity.

9624.name: Braheem's Magic Shop
description: You enter a shop crowded with bookshelves and clutterd with scrolls. The
owner seems to be hard at work on his latest magical creation. You see a
small sign on the wall.
Welcome to Braheem's.
LIST -Shows you all of my wonderful creations.
VAL  -Shows what an item might be worth to me.
SELL -Allows you to rid yourself of excessive magic items.
BUY  -Allows you to rid youself of excessive cash.

9720.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river calms a bit after being thrashed in the interior of
the mountain. Although still deep within the rocks you can see
faint traces of green to the east.

9536.name: West Ishtar Drive
description: A cool breeze blows up off the river chilling the sweat otherwise present
on you skin. Orders and sometimes curses can be heard from the west
in the direction of the warehouses. The common square opens up to the east
and Ishtar Drive continues west.

9726.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: Small animals and herd animals can be heard in the distance, though
you don't actually see any near the river. Perhaps the steep slopes
pervent them from using the river.

9529.name: East Main Street
description: East Main Street continues east and west here.  To the north is a
wide ramp leading up to a complex series of scaffolds and timbered
structures, all standing on stilts.  Further east lies the gates of
the city, while west one can hear the bustle of market square.

9694.name: Tunnel in the Dungeon
description: You stand in a roughly hewn stone tunnel with cells to the north and
south. The tunnel continues east and west.

9835.name: {CEast of the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: You are in the Harbor Of New Thalos. To the west is a dock to
where you can tie up to. Ships, large and small move about in this
cramped little space. To the east is a large stone wall to help keep
the rough surf out.
{x  To the west is the Northern Entrance of the New Thalos Harbor.

9566.name: Alley
description: This culvert dead ends as the darkness swirls all about.  Above is
the grating leading to the dark alley, while to the south is some kind
of doorway, cloaked in a magical veil of darkness.

9600.name: Underground
description: The small passage continues west and east.

9676.name: Guest Room
description: This is a simple room used for visiting noblemen. A small dresser stands
on the east wall with a mirror hung right above it. A queen sized bed made
up in satin sheets stands in the middle of the room against the south
wall under a window. The only obvious exit is north back out into the
hallway.
Looking out this window you can see the grounds of the palace that
seperate the walls of the palace from the building itself.
You see a the fighting image of some armor clad humanoid wielding a weapon.

9627.name: Repair Shop
description: One of the most popular shops in New Thalos, this shop is always a hive
of activity. It is almost inhuman the way one man can fix all the area's
armor singlehandedly. If you have an item in need of repair simply give
it to the man behind the counter.

9819.name: {c[ {CDOCK {&--{MA{&-- {C] {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: A large stone dock cuts into the water from the stone coastline of
the Great Realms.  Above these stone docks lies the New Thalos Harbor,
one of the older harbors on the Eastern Shores.  The boats docked here
are mixed together, the ships of the sea with their brother, the ships
of the air.  A staircase leads upwards to the top of the docks and
into the harbor.
This is a safe haven for people and ships.

9827.name: {c[ {CDOCK {&--{MF{&-- {C] {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: A large stone dock cuts into the water from the stone coastline of
the Great Realms.  Above these stone docks lies the New Thalos Harbor,
one of the older harbors on the Eastern Shores.  The boats docked here
are mixed together, the ships of the sea with their brother, the ships
of the air.  A staircase leads upwards to the top of the docks and
into the harbor.
This is a safe haven for people and ships.

9837.name: Along The Shore
description: You are near the shore of New Thalos. The surf crashes up on dirt and
sand. Some creatures crawl around here, looking for something to eat.
The Sea of Swords lies to the east, land to the west.

9867.name: Large Dojo Room
description: This room is lined with bamboo rugs and straw mats, while
along the walls are differing lengths of staves.  The entire
room is filled with the scent of incense, though not heavily
so in order to keep the breathing of the Monks clear.  The
smell of sweat hangs in the air, and to the east is a door
that leads to the guildmaster's private meditation chambers.

9758.name: Alcove
description: This alcove is very dank and cave-like.  The walls are of granite
polished to a sheen and cold as ice.  The sounds of dripping fluids
(you don't really know what kind) surround you, but there are no evident
puddles to be found.

9757.name: Entrance to the Vampire's Guild
description: here are some aristocratic-looking individuals in this shadowy room,
and each of them sizes you up contemptuously.  You make your way through
the pale visages of snobs and self-styled royalty.  To the east is the
mercenaries guild, while a dank staircase leads down into the darkness.

9693.name: Tunnel in the Dungeon
description: You stand in a roughly hewn stone tunnel with cells to the north and
south. The tunnel continues east and west.

9558.name: Alley
description: This is a dark alley running between the palace and city hall. Not a lot
here, unless you're partial to spiders and rats.

9851.name: Inn Walk
description: The Inn Walk is a small stretch of road directly across from the
palace that leads to the larger and more prominent inns in town: The
Dancing Daemon Inn.  The inn looks small and ordinary, save the
patrons which sit at the windows.  Some watch quietly the bustle of
the market square, while others literally hang from them, enjoying
their merryment.  Sultan's Walk is to the west while the doorway to
the inn awaits to the east.

9834.name: {CEast of the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: To the east the Sea of Swords stretches out all the way to the
horizon, far off the continent of Faerun.  To the west a large rock
wall stabs out from the dark blue waters of the Sea of Swords, the
ancient harbor wall of New Thalos.  Behind the protective wall lies
the harbor, filled with both ships of the sea, and ships of the air.

9735.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river flows south in the southern end of this wide valley. The walls
of the valley close in to the south.

9701.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9505.name: Southern Market Square
description: The large square of markets fills your vision. Strange sights and sounds,
those known only to the New Thalos market, barrage your senses. The only
hope of making any sense of what's going on here is to wander around. The
Market continues north, west, and east, with the Medina trailing off south.

9515.name: Northern Market Square
description: You stand in one of the most heavily used parts of town. To the north lies
the Palace of New Thalos and the Casbah; east west and south of here the
busy market thrives with life.

9542.name: East Ishtar Drive
description: The sound of squawking gulls and the smell of rotting fish gives you a hint
of your location. The Ishtar River flows south of you, but looks crystal
clear, so it cannot be the source of this putrid smell. Looking north you
notice a small sign hanging over the dump.
THE DUMP OF NEW THALOS
Enter at your own risk.
-the management

9602.name: Underground
description: The small passage continues west and east.

9508.name: Southwestern Market Square
description: This area of market square seems relatively quiet, save the
high-pitched banter of the shopkeepers attempting to lure people into
their stores.  A general store is to the west, while south is a small
store named Ahkeem's, who is known in this town for making items
suited for any adventurer or person looking to wear the latest in
fashion.  The market's sprawl continues east and north of here.
You see the general store.

9714.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9716.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9678.name: Garden
description: You have entered the Sultan's private gardens. A light sweat breaks out
on your skin from the humidity here. All around you are thousands of
exotic plants and flowers. The sweet smell of jasmine and honeysuckle
reminds you of happier days at home. Off to the north, through the palm
trees, you see a delicate white gazebo. To your right stands a gold sign.
A path leads out into the hallway and west towards the gazebo.
||        Welcome to my humble garden. I have created this             ||
||        tiny bit of paradise for the pleasure of my people.          ||
||        Take only pictures... Leave only footprints...               ||
||                                 The Sultan                          ||

9784.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river broadens even more here and the waters become murky. The
smell of saltwater has reached you from the east. The Sea Of Swords
cannot be far away. To the east you can see the faint outline
of a city and to the north you see a large boat launch.

9534.name: West Ishtar Drive
description: A few men walk by almost pushing you out of the way as they go about
their business of loading and unloading the boats. An entrance to the
huge warehouses of New Thalos is to the north and the Ishtar River
quietly flows by to the south. Ishtar Drive continues east and west.

9730.name: Casbah
description: The north wall of New Thalos follows along the Casbah.  To the
south stretch many modest buildings of the old nomad style that
characterizes much of this city.  The walkway is paved in smooth
cobblestones, most likely excavated from the nearby shores of the fast
flowing Ishtar River to the south.  The Casbah continues east and
west.

9801.name: {RH{rarbor {GR{goad{x {&[ {CDock {MA {C---> {&]{x
description: You walk down Harbor Road. Merchants, pirates, sailors walk
around here with crates and boxes. Some leer at you, some just
keep on walking.

9621.name: Nabil's Exotic Animals
description: You stand in a large building decorated with black marble and red satin.
A lavishly flourished sign details several exotics creatures and Nabil's
smiling face.  Cages crowd the room, some large, some small, and filled with
animals from the four corners of the world.  Various feeding and grooming
supplies fill the back half of the room, along with an assortment of
leashes for everything from giant rats to minotaur lizards.

9841.name: Wandering Bard Inn
description: Welcome to the "Wandering Bard Inn".  The inn is very large, and has been
built for beauty.  The walls are made from hardwood, carved very carefully.
The floors are black marble, shining like the stars at night.  A large fire
pit sits in the middle of the room, warming the whole inn.  Couches line the
fireplace, for people to warm up to.  A hall extends eastwards, leading to
the inn rooms, which has more powerful healing rates.  A healer sits in a
large soft chair, casting spells on diffrent people.

9530.name: East Main Street
description: The Main street through eastern New Thalos begins here and heads
westward towards the marketplace.  One of the main gates can be seen
to the east, and Braheem's Magic Shop awaits your business to the
north.  To the south lies a dark alley where several shady looking
individuals gather.

9789.name: {R<{r<{R- {*T{&he {ME{mast {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {*P{&ier {R-{r>{R>{x
description: The actual shoreline is getting slightly smaller to the west as the
Pier of New Thalos stretches eastwards out into the Sea of Swords.
Northwards the docks off the northern pier can be seen, random ships
being birthed in between them.  Southwards the Port of New Thalos is
further back, also randomly filled with both ocean and air going
ships.  The pier ends shortly to the east.

9866.name: Entrance to the Guild of Monks
description: Quiet and sparsely decorated, the small building here is open to
the Sultan's Walk, separated only by an archway.  There is a
stairwell to the left which leads upward to a second level, closed
off by a thick oak door stained with a dark resin.

9773.name: On the Dark River
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9740.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river continues north and south from here through a water
eroded valley.

9715.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9553.name: Casbah
description: You have almost reached the end of the avenue in this direction. Walking
towards the north-east corner of the city you notice the population density
here is much less then the rest of the town. A few old men hobbling on
canes and young men intent on studies are the only travelers of the path
to the library on a regular basis. The avenue continues east and west from
here

9554.name: Casbah
description: The avenue ends here, turning south to become Kali Row. Traveling in that
direction will take you to the library and the grand dance hall of the city.
The Northeast Tower of the wall is accessible here up a spiral staircase.

9800.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RH{rarbor {RG{rates{x
description: You stand infront of a pair of large rought iron gates. To the
south a large newly built harbor sits. You see 7 large docks
stretching out into the mass of the Sea Of Swords. To the far
end of the south you see a large shipyard, and the skeletons
of ships. To the north east you see the old dock that was
once for New Thalos.

9653.name: Jail
description: You are in jail. For some reason the god's feel you've screwed up
pretty bad and should be put away safely for a while.

9598.name: Tank's Room
description: Now here's a room that is easy to understand. A bed, a dresser, and a
rack for weapons and armor are all that occupy it. Some posters adorn
the walls, to add color, proclaiming things such as Live fast, Die Young,
and a homemade one in the corner with a picture of Ice and under it the
inscription, "I LOVE the resurrection spell". The only thing out of
place in this happy-go-lucky room is mounted head of Crimson Death.

9785.name: River delta
description: This is where the river empties out into The Sea Of Swords. The backrush
of water has kicked up a lot of sand and the blue sea is stained where
the river empties. Looking east, all you can see is water....all the way
to the horizon. North of here is a small dock you think you should be
able to reach with out too much trouble. The river stretches off to
the west back towards New Thalos.

9604.name: Chamber of the High Priest
description: You have entered the chamber of the most holy man in New Thalos. The
High Priest advises the Sultan on all matters in the world of the sacred.
From what you have heard however, this holy man has a bit of a temper,
and he doesn't look very happy that you've disturbed his prayers.
The only obvious exit is south.

9704.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9691.name: Jailer's Room
description: Climbing down the old wooden ladder you enter a small cave-like
room. There is a small bench with some old magazines and a low
burning candle sitting off to one side. A door is set into the
stone on the east wall, and the steel grating opens up above.

9712.name: Airship Parking
description: This is a well-kept parking lot.  The asphalt seems scrubbed, and
the architecture is quite well-done.  Lines are painted on the
asphalt, denoting where airships may be parked, and there is a
building in the northwest corner of the lot.  A sign on the building
reads, "{BNew Thalos Courier{x"

9649.name: Hay Loft
description: Not as big as the ones you see on farms in the country, this hay loft
serves as a storage area for the horses in the stables. The young boy
you saw with the shovel seems to have taken up residence on the second
story.

9646.name: Secret Yard
description: This is a hidden yard known to only a few people in New Thalos. Here you
may train in the arts of stealing, picking locks, and becoming almost
invisible. A small staircase leads back up to the unicorn.
You see some small scratches in the wall to the south.

9637.name: Ye Old Leather Shoppe
description: You are standing on a thick oriental rug surrounded on all sides by racks
of numerous leather goods. A few women sit on leather cushions sewing in
some detail work on custom ordered jackets.  There is a note on the counter.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much an item is worth
SELL : sells an item for a generous sum
BUY :  buy an item for an outrageous price.

9808.name: Manager's Office
description: You walk into the Manager's office of the shipyard. A desk
stands in the middle of the room, stacked high with orders.
A few things like a sofa and a wooden chair line the wall.
Large paintings of ships hang from the wall, showing the
grand ships that have been rolled off here.

9762.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west as it meanders through the woods.

9724.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river flows out from the city down a long winding gully towards
the Sea of Dragons. To the south of you lies the great eastern desert
and north a wide open expanse of grass. You can just barely make out
a road that seems to be traveling alongside the river but the banks are
too steep for you to see very far.

9822.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x {c[ {CBefore Dock {MB {C]{x
description: You are out over deep water. The harbor of New Thalos lies
to the west. The large blue sea of The Sea of Swords lies to
the east.

9576.name: Underground
description: The passage continues north and south.

9860.name: A Boarding Plank to Nowhere
description: A ship is being built just east of here.  It looks to be nearly
complete, though right now it is too dangerous to check out.  The only
way off now is via magic or a word of recall.

9507.name: Southeastern Market Square
description: In this corner of the market some of the largest warriors in the land
tower over you. It's easy to understand why they hangout here once you
notice the weapon shop and the armory close by. Perhaps you might stop
in and take a look at the wares these shops have to offer.

9504.name: Medina
description: You are walking along a wide open expanse of road connecting the market
square to the common square. Panhandlers, beggars, and other such riff-
raff wander about hoping to catch those few who with open hearts.
The medina continues to the south and the market spreads out to the north.
You see the market.
You see the medina.

9778.name: Freefall
description: As your fingers slowly slip from the handguides you feel a sudden
euphoria as you freefall the 200 + feet to your death.

9747.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues its journey eastward flowing through the
plains. To the west you see the peaks of large snow capped
mountains and to the east you see the outline of a large city.

9662.name: North-East Tower
description: You stand on one of the four towers guarding the city. To the north you
see the wide plains and then the forest. South of here you see the city
and the great eastern desert beyond.

9806.name: {RH{rarbor {GR{goad{x {&[ {CDock {MF {C---> {&]{x
description: You stand at the end of the Harbor Road. A Group of Sailors
stand here, talking about what adventure to do next. You see
a pair of large wooden gates, like ones you see at a construction
site, past it giant skeletons of new ships rise above the fence.

9689.name: Throne Room
description: You stand in the throne room of the mighty Sultan of New Thalos. Guards
stand at attention near his side ready to make the ultimate sacrifice for
their beloved leader. The gold inlaid throne studded with jewels stands
upon a mable dias. The Sultan is not a man to be trifled with.

9642.name: Shipwright
description: The wood under you feet creaks from years of being soaked in saltwater. An
old man with a curly, grey beard stand behind a small counter waiting to
take your order. Behind him are mounted various model sailboats and large
fish.  There is a large poster stapled to the counter.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much an item is worth to the shipwright
SELL : sells an item to the shipwright for a generous sum
BUY : The shipwright's FAVORITE command lets you have an item for his low low pr
ice.

9664.name: Tanner's Street
description: This cluttered side street is mostly ocupied by construction workers.
The new houses are being constructed on either side of the street.
I hate being a Tanner

9573.name: Alley
description: This is a small corner in the alley behind the warehouses and the guild
of warrior's. You notice  some small scrapings to the west.

9656.name: Mason Street
description: This clutered side street is mostly occupied by construction workers.
The new houses are being constructed on either side of the street.

9501.name: Reception Area
description: You are now standing in the reception of New Thalos.  A huge
mahogany desk is here along with two sofas and a coffee table covered
in magazines.  The plush carpeting under your feet is a nice change
from the rugged paths you are used to travelling.  A chrome stairway
spirals downstairs to the tavern of the Dancing Daemon Inn, gateway to
your adventures here in New Thalos and beyond.
The stairs lead down to the Daemon.
You see a picture of Hammor on the front porch of the Danjerhaus,
drinking a guinness stout and petting Big Guy the Cat.
You see a picture of Shark standing behind his desk screaming at a newbie.
Through a window in the back you see a large aquarium. The newbie seems to
be cowering in fear.
You see a picture of Loki... at least you think it's Loki.
He seems to be hiding from the camera.
You see a picture of Felix here, standing before the arena.
He seems to be doing a body count.

9596.name: Ice's Room
description: Brrrrrr, it's COLD in here. Must be 30 below. It would seem the cleric
Ice lives up to his name. Healing herbs and other such things line
the walls in racks, holy symbols and pictures cover the walls, and
the smiley face button stuck on his bedpost tells you he'll probably
help you out all he can. As you turn to leave the room the mounted head
of Kalas stares past you into emptiness.

9770.name: West Ishtar Drive
description: West Ishtar Drive begins here, amidst the rushing waters of the
Ishtar River.  Several small boats sit tied at the shores, though the
city wall and a rather steep dropoff prevents easy access to them.
The smell of fish lingers in the air, and is not a very pleasant smell
at all.  The drive continues east and west.

9607.name: Craft Street
description: This clutered side street is mostly ocupied by construction workers.
The new houses are being constructed on either side of the street.

9671.name: Grand Dining Hall
description: A long oaken table, coverd with silverware, plates, and a tablecloth
with gold trim, dominates the room. Although no diners occupy the room
as of yet, servants sprint about setting the table and placing condiments.
The kitchen entrance is to the east, and two huge double doors open into
the hallway north.

9697.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9643.name: Drafting Room
description: The walls are covered with paper sketchings of hull designs. This room is
used by the shipwright to build his creations on paper before making
a single cut in wood.

9670.name: Outside the wall
description: You are in a small clearing outside the east wall of the city. The
ground seems well trodden but you can see no apparent exit save that
north.

9807.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RH{rarbor {RS{rhipyard{x
description: You enter a large dirt courtyard. To the west you see a small
building, big enough for five people. To the east you see a
very large building, with its doors slightly cracked open. To
the south you see another fence and large ship frames, and
shipbuilders hanging from ropes knocking nails into the frame.

9526.name: West Main Street
description: You are strolling on the street between Nabil's Exotic Animals and the general
store. To the west you hear a roadcrew at work and to the East, the sounds of
commerce taking place.  To the south is the entrance to the Ranger's Guild,
while to the north is an entrance to the Druid's Guild.  The air is filled
ith the smell of gold and riches.  On the wall of the store is a poster.
A wealthy man in red robes is smiling at you.  The caption reads:
THE SULTAN REMINDS YOU TO PAY YOUR TAXES!

9756.name: Druid's Atrium
description: The ceiling is open here, showing a peaceful sky above.  An
ancient-looking man is sitting cross-legged in the middle of the room,
holding his hands up to the sky and meditating.  The atrium extends
further to the east, while the doorway south leads back into the
floral room.

9711.name: The New Thalos Port Courier
description: You are in a large warehouse.  Boxes are stacked all over the
floor, reaching almost to the sky.  A few men, levitating about, carry
boxes from one point to the other, and some offices are near the
northern wall of the warehouse.

9755.name: Floral Room
description: This floral room is permeated with the scents of exotic flowers and
spices.  A pair of children are running about playing tag in the bushes
along the wall, and a woman you can only assume to be their mother is
watching them with dismay, occasionally yelling for them to settle down.
The wall leading into the guildmaster's room is formed into the shape of
an obese tree, with a large gnarled door in the center.

9700.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9734.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river flows south through a valley in the mountains. You can see a
small village to the west.

9848.name: The New Thalos Depot
description: You stand on the depot of New Thalos.  You see a single railway going to
the west, towards Westbridge and Torregiano.  The platform here is filled
with people waiting to board the trains, some sitting on the benches against
the wall of the station.  You are now in New Thalos.

9685.name: Guard Room
description: You stand in a barren chamber lined with nothing but cots and footlockers.
The guards come here when off duty to sleep, for they may only leave the
palace grounds with special permission. The only exit is to the south.

9833.name: {CEast of the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: To the east the Sea of Swords stretches out all the way to the
horizon, far off the continent of Faerun.  To the west a large rock
wall stabs out from the dark blue waters of the Sea of Swords, the
ancient harbor wall of New Thalos.  Behind the protective wall lies
the harbor, filled with both ships of the sea, and ships of the air.

9585.name: {BUnder the {rSouthern {gN{Gew {gT{Ghalos {RBr{rid{Rge{x
description: You hear your voice echo as you float under the bridge above. The city
construction crews have just recently finished the small ladder giving
common-folk easy access to the river.  From here, the river flows east and
west.

9652.name: Dance Hall
description: You seem to have missed a huge party.  The janitors are here cleaning up
the confetti and cigarette butts.  Hundreds of empty beer mugs on the
tables surrounding the dance floor suggest that the citizens love their
drink.  There is still a banner on the wall.
H A P P Y   B I R T H D A Y   T O   U S

9630.name: Shadowy Guild's Alley
description: The guilds which are built here are frowned upon by many citizens
of New Thalos, but they have remained and flourished mainly due to the
high demand of the services offered by their members.  Those who
cannot fight their own battles come here to hire others to do it for
them, as do those who feel that it is worth the price to hire an
experienced student of the shadowed arts.  West lies a dark corridor
that smells of decay, while east lies an
You notice some small scratches in the floor next to the eastern wall.

9549.name: Casbah
description: The activity here is only slightly less than chaotic. Young boys run to
and fro with stern intent, and older gentleman swagger down the street
towards the library. To the west you can see the tall towers of the
northern gate, and the avenue continues east.

9512.name: The {rSouthern {gN{Gew {gT{Ghalos {RBr{rid{Rge{x
description: Walking over the bridge you see the rushing waters of the Ishtar River.
To the south you see the Southern Gate of New Thalos and the Common
Square stretches out to the north.

9500.name: Entrance of the Dancing Daemon Inn
description: You find yourself in an entrance foyer to the Dancing Daemon Inn. Chrome
plated stairs spiral up to the reception area. To the south you hear the
sounds of merriment and drinking and from the west you hear the bustling
activity of New Thalos.
You see people dancing and drinking.
The spiral stairs lead up to the reception area.

9667.name: Outside the Northern Gate
description: You stand outside the gate of New Thalos. The city lies to the south, and
wilderness to the north.  The Sands of Sorrow continues to the east
and west.

9668.name: Outside the Eastern Gate
description: You stand outside the protective walls of the city. The massive iron gate
sits to the west and the unknown awaits you eastward.

9677.name: Hall
description: The long hall continues here with a wooden door in the south wall. On the
north wall hangs the picture of some forgotten nobleman who once ruled
the land.

9741.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river continues north and south from here through a water
eroded valley.

9820.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x {c[ {CBefore Dock {MA {C]{x
description: You are out over deep water. The harbor of New Thalos lies
to the west. The large blue sea of The Sea of Swords lies to
the east.

9552.name: Port Walk
description: The scaffold walk connects intersections here.  Through the spaces
between the timbers, one can see the ground below: a torn up street
that was once Guild Street.  A strong breeze kicks up a cloud of dust
and all around you the people shield their faces from the sands.  Port
Walk continues north and south from here.

9754.name: Entrance to the Guild of Druids
description: A young man is standing here speaking familiarly with a ranger.  The two
turn to regard you, flash a pair of friendly smiles, and then promptly go
back to whatever it is they were talking about.  There isn't much else to
do here but move along.  South is back to main street, and north is the
floral room.

9673.name: Hall
description: You stand at an intersection of the hallways. Wooden corridors lead off in
all directions except west; the garden of the palace can be entered there.

9792.name: West Main Street
description: West Main Street continues through New Thalos, leading to the
western gates to the west and into the large market square to the
east.  The sounds of haggling and moving goods can be heard nearby.
To the north, the walls of a large palace can be scarcely seen between
the buildings.  Several shops lie on either side of the street, though
here there are no entrances to them.

9759.name: Vampire's Crypt
description: Sitting at a desk lit softly by a single candle is a very tall figure
dressed in jet black.  He turns at your approach and smiles broadly,
showing a row of sharp teeth.  Quietly you are motioned to sit down
while this vampire finishes writing whatever he is writing.  The only
obvious exit is back through the doorway into the alcove.
You notice a faint glow coming through a crack in the ceiling.

9550.name: Casbah
description: Walking along the cobblestone path you feel secure with the walls of the
city towering over you. You hear the scraping sounds of metal on stone
and look up to see a large, strong guard looking out to the north. To the
east lies the intersection on Guildsman's Row and the northern gate is
a short walk to the west.

9564.name: Port Walk
description: This new walk that now stands where Guild Street once stood now
houses the New Thalos airship port, which rises high above the
rooftops of the city.  The port is accentuated with many interwoven
beams of lumber--a material that is plentiful in these parts.  And
thanks to the builder's efforts, much of the unsightly forests to the
north have since been clear cutted, bringing a clear view to pilots
who search for the city of New Thalos.  Port Walk continues up the
ramp here into the port complex, and intersects East Main Street to
the south.

9546.name: Casbah
description: The wall of the palace curves south from here, a darkened alley runs along
it in that direction. West of here you see the steps of the city hall
and notice the increase in the number of guards. To the east the avenue
continues.

9826.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x {c[ {CBefore Dock {ME {C]{x
description: You are out over deep water. The harbor of New Thalos lies
to the west. The large blue sea of The Sea of Swords lies to
the east.

9593.name: Underground
description: The small passage continues west and east.

9597.name: Naazgul's Room
description: Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky,
Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone,
Nine for Mortal Men doomed to die,
One for the Dark Lord on his Dark Throne
In the Land of Mordor where Shadows lie.
One ring to rule them all, One ring to find them,
One ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them
In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.
If I have to explain, you wouldn't understand.

9669.name: Outside the West Gate
description: You stand outside the city walls, the iron gate to the east. The city lies
in that direction and the road to Westbridge lies west.

9797.name: Sea Of Swords
description: The ocean spreads out in all directions rolling gently. In the distance
you can see an island on the horizon. To the west you see the mainland.

9746.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river meanders through the foothills of the eastern mountains.
The air is dryer on this side of the continental divide and it seems
a bit warmer.

9728.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9517.name: Eastern Market Square
description: You stand in the market of New Thalos, the gem of the desert. The
market is the hub of the city; all trade and commerce of any significance is
carried on here. The market spreads out in all directions save east; here
Main Street heads for the eastern gate.

9620.name: Temple Square
description: You are standing on the meeting grounds of those with holy intentions.
Monks, bards, paladins and clerics mill around either preaching or
listening to their fellows preach. Huge marble steps lead up to the
gates of the temple and Main Street lies to the south.

9768.name: Atop the Library
description: The chain leads upward to the top of the library's roof, which is
less a roof than a small, fenced in section of alley.  As the hunting
lodge and library were both built below the level of the city streets,
this area lies slightly above them, with a small jump to the west
leading back down to a dark alley.  The sounds of the nearby market
square can be heard here, though this place remains relatively quiet
and free from intrusion.

9608.name: Inside the Temple
description: The temple continues here, but not on such a grand scale. The place
still looks immaculate. To the north you see the chamber of the High
Priest and a sign on the door in BIG letters thats says DO NOT DISTURB.
To the south is the entrance to the Cleric's Guild.

9661.name: Kitchen
description: Your footsteps echo off the stone tiles of the kitchen. On the south wall
you see the large fireplace and a huge copper pot bubbling merrily. The
chef is busy chopping up greens and other vegetables at the wooden table
for tonight's meal. Servants scurry about grabbing utensils and preparing
fresh hares. A small door leads out into the hall northward and the door
to the dining hall is west.

9846.name: Treasure Room
description: VICTORY IS YOURS!  Hao'keth is dead by your blade, now his meager
treasure is yours.  The room is filled with a bunches of papers and
other objects of now value.  A large Chest is in the room and thats
where the good stuff must be.

9782.name: On the Plains
description: You stand on an open field of grass. The forest to the north is
closer but still a good distance away. To the south a small dirt
path has been trodden into the ground heading towards New Thalos.

9767.name: Ranger's Library - Rare Book Section
description: A small room off to the side of the library has been built to hold
the rare book collection of the Ranger's Guild.  The shelves, though
newly installed, look to be very old, and have already gathered a
thick layer of dust and cobwebs.  A beam of light falls to the floor
here from a skylight.  A long chain dangles down from it, and the
skylight remains slightly open...

9650.name: Grand Entrance
description: Nowhere have you seen such an obscene display of wealth than in this
corridor. The shag carpeting under your feet makes it seem as if you are
walking on a cloud. Platinum candelabras hang delicately from the ceiling
casting light on the ancient tapestries adorning the walls. The crick
in your neck tells you it's time to stop staring. To the west the
numerous halls of the palace begin and the gate lies to the east.

9559.name: Alley
description: The alley ends here.
You see a manhole covering an opening in the road.

9623.name: Witch's Brew
description: The first thing you notice as you walk into this spacious shop is the
hundreds of candles that line the shelves. The swirling mist that surrounds
your feet makes it seem that you have stepped into a gateway to another
plane. A tall brunette stands behind her cluttered table unaware of
your entrance.  An ornately lettered sign floats above your head.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much an item is worth to Elvira
SELL : sells an item to Elvira for a generous sum
BUY : Elvira's FAVORITE command lets you have an item for her low low price.

9640.name: Warehouse
description: You are standing in a large room used to store merchandise made in the
city before it is shipped off. All the items here are made in New Thalos
and shipped to other parts of the land.

9783.name: Edge of the forest
description: You stand at the edge of a forest.  The line of trees continues as far as
the eye can see to the east and west.  A large expanse of grass spreads out
to the south while a low grassy path continues northward.

9578.name: Underground
description: The alley turns again here and heads south and west. You notice a small
glint of light from above.

9651.name: Library
description: This building holds the vast collection of books and documents that
have been brought here by the committee appointed to recover the
lost knowledge of Thalos.  Rows of shelves, filled with book in every
condition, lines the walls.  The air has the aroma of old parchment and
glue.

9774.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods. You
hear the sounds of chopping wood far off in the distance.

9631.name: Mercenary's Guild
description: This is the storage room for the mercenaries to be hired.

9683.name: Garden Gazebo
description: Walking through the gardens you come across a small white wooden structure.
The sounds of birds, the smell of flowers, ahhh paradise. You believe
you have never been in a more peaceful setting.

9572.name: Alley
description: You are on a small alley between the repair shop and the general store.
Nothing much here but small rodents and dust.

9618.name: Mage's Courtyard
description: You enter a small tiled courtyard with a small fountain in the middle.
Around the sides are four wrought iron benches with cushions where the
mages of the land sit and exchange ideas. To the west stands a two-story
tower where the leader of the mage's guild performs his experiments.

9506.name: Center of Market Square
description: You are standing on the Center of Market Square, the famous square of
New Thalos. A large, peculiar looking statue is standing in the middle
of the square. The square extends in every direction.
Before you is a statue of the Mighty Beholder!
A great beast with multiple eyes and wicked... wicked... um.... eyes...
The Mighty Beholder is in Excellent condition.

9736.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river begins to speed up as it cascades down this mountain
crevase. High above you a small rope bridge sways in the wind.

9509.name: Western Market Square
description: This area of the square seems a bit more subdued than the rest. You
notice that most of the outland adventurers mill around the southern
end of the market, while the townfolk seem to keep their business in
the northern end.  West Main Street begins here and heads for the
gate. The market's expanse fills the other directions.

9531.name: Inside the Eastern Gate
description: Two large stone towers imbedded in the wall loom over you. The massive
iron gate, emblazened with the crest of New Thalos, swings easily on
four ornately crafted hinges. It is obvious the makers of this city spared no
expense in protecting their home.  Main street heads towards the market
westward and the wilderness beckons from the east. To the north lies the
entrance to the mages' guild.

9666.name: Shrine of Allah
description: As you step into this room you seem to leave the material plane. The
walls here are decorated with beautiful, multi-colored tiles. There
is a strange stillness about the air. You sense the presence of an
almighty being.

9818.name: Harbor Master's Office
description: You stand in command central of the harbor. This office is
not that large, a desk stands in the middle, papers stacked
high BUT neatly. A large shelf stands behind the desk with books
of imports and exports. To one side of the shelf a large map
of the coast shows, and then the sea itself. To the other side
a map of the area (New Thalos to Westbridge) hangs. Around the
room there are pictures of ships, and other harbors.

9513.name: Inside the South Gate
description: Two large stone towers rise up to greet you with the massive iron gate
swinging on ornately crafted hinges and emblazoned with the crest of
New Thalos. The makers of the city spared no expense in rebuilding the
defenses or their home. The Ishtar River bridge lies to the north and
wilderness to the south.

9570.name: Alley
description: This is a dead end to the tiny alley.  There is an unusual amount of wear apparent on the ground.
You see a small iron circle imbedded in the ground.

9751.name: Entrance to the Guild of Rangers
description: The bustling sound of people going about their business can be
heard a little less clearly here as you enter the ranger guild.  This
room is mostly bare, just wooden plank walls and a door leading into
the next room.  North leads back to the main street of New Thalos,
while a short flight of stairs takes you downward into a hunting
lodge.

9781.name: On the Plains
description: You stand on an open expanse of grass extending in all directions. To
the south of you stand the might northern gates of New Thalos. East
and west of you the grassy fields continue and north, in the distance,
you see a line of trees.

9772.name: {&[{YA{yirship {GP{gar{Gk{&] {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river of Westbridge blows now between two walls on either side
making up its shore.  Above is the city of Westbridge as the river
passes the three bridges connecting the northern city with the
southern half.  On either side wooden docks line the river walls,
built for the parking of airships in the area.

9632.name: Entrance to the Thieves' Guild
description: This small, dark room has a single torch mounted in the wall for light.
There is a small wooden bench and a book lying on it. The assassin
guarding the entrance from 'outsiders' stands as you walk in.

9729.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9832.name: {CEast of the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: To the east the Sea of Swords stretches out all the way to the
horizon, far off the continent of Faerun.  To the west a large rock
wall stabs out from the dark blue waters of the Sea of Swords, the
ancient harbor wall of New Thalos.  Behind the protective wall lies
the harbor, filled with both ships of the sea, and ships of the air.

9639.name: Filthy Unicorn
description: A draft chills your bones as you enter, though you see no open window or
door. Hooded figures lurk around in the shadows and speak in low voices.
A flash of steel lets you know that weapons are in great abundance
in this crowd. As you quickly check your beltpouch you notice
a small staircase leading down.

9776.name: Atop the Atrium
description: There is a gust of fresh air as the ceiling opening leads to a
small, fenced in alcove just above where the druid's atrium lies.  As
the atrium and guild house were built below the level of the city,
this area atop them lies just a few paces above the st Building walls
surround it in all directions save west, where there is a dark alley.

9562.name: Intersection: Port and Tanner
description: The Port Walk intersects another walkway here called Tanner.  There
are still remnants of construction as bundles of lumber lie all about.
The private hangars stand at either side of the street, while the Port
Walk continues north and south.

9599.name: Inside the Castle of Clan MacCleod
description: You have entered the grand hall of the old castle which stood here
when the first bricks of New Thalos were laid.  The castle itself is
small, built in the time when stone and metal were expensive and
sparse.  A small set of stairs leads up to a landing area, where
branches several rooms in all directions.  To the north, the front of
the castle can be accessed at Kali Row.

9524.name: West Main Street
description: This is the main road traveling though the city. To the south you hear
the hammering of the repair shop and to the north is the grassy field
known as the temple square. Main street continues east and west.

9610.name: Donation Room
description: This room is new to the temple.  It was created during the hard times
that have struck the city in recent decades.  Luckily for them the sultan
had been hoarding some of the basic necessities for just such an occasion.
These days the donation room depends on the generosity of wealthy
adventureres, and a curse on any that walk in to get all.

9589.name: Dark Passage
description: The small passage continues east and west from here. Again you notice
something peculiar about the wall, this time to the north, but you
fail to find any secret doors. Voices can be faintly heard from the north.

9742.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river continues north and south from here through a water
eroded valley.

9647.name: Dump
description: This is the place where the people of the city dump their trash. Due to
the constant winds blowing down the moutains the smell is usually blown
outside the walls and over the desert.

9545.name: West Casbah
description: You have almost reached the end of the avenue in this direction, the
number of guards in this part of town is nearly doubled. To the north
the familiar city wall protects you from the wilderness. Looking south
marble stairs rise towards the entrance of city hall surrounded by
massive white pillars. The avenue continues west and south from here.

9765.name: West Ishtar Drive
description: Ishtar Drive follows the Ishtar River east and west here, as the
strong odor of fish permeates the air.  To the north is a fish stand,
most likely the source of the offending odors, though perhaps at least
there is something good to be bought there.

9629.name: Adbul's Armor
description: The sound of hammering metal grows louder as you enter the armory.  Young
boys run to and fro carrying buckets of water and coal.  A few dwarves work
on sections of armor in the back of the shop, their hammers working too fast
to follow.  The walls are adorned with all of Abdul's prize creations.  Here
you can purchase suits of armor meant to keep monsters from hacking you into
little pieces.
A note on the wall beckons newbies.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much an item is worth to Abdul
SELL : sells an item to Abdul for a generous sum
BUY : Abdul's FAVORITE command lets you have an item for his low low price.

9786.name: {CMouth of the {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{bive{Br{C on {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: You are on the clear blue seas of The Sea Of Swords.
Water extends in all directions as far as the eye
can see. Off in the distance you think you might
see a small dock to the north.

9817.name: {BAbove {&[ {CDock --{MA{C-- {&]{B at {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: You stand on the dock. It extends out into the blue
Sea of Swords. Merchants, Captains, Sailors and all
diffrent types of people walk here. Crates float overhead
from large pulleys and onto the harbor road. People fish
off the end of the docks.

9708.name: New Thalos Port Checkpoint
description: You have entered the New Thalos Port Courier Checkpoint.  An
opening to the east leads to the docks, and to the south is airship
parking.

9731.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9644.name: Forge
description: Very much like the weaponsmith this man deals in the molding of metal. It
seems that most of his creations deal with horses. On the walls you see
several horseshoes made of iron. The room is hot, hotter than the desert
just south of here, and one wonders how the smithy can stand it.  Some
letters have been burned into the wooden wall.
LIST : gives you a list of items for sale.
VALUE : tells you how much the blacksmith will give you for his merchandise
SELL : sells an item to the blacksmith
BUY : buy an item from the blacksmith for a fair price

9516.name: Northeastern Market Square
description: Pandemonium. Chaos. Madness. A few other choice words come to mind as you
gaze into this corner of the market. The vegetable stand seems quiet enough
so you have to assume the noise comes from the Butchery. You have to
think for a while before you muster the will to enter this shop.
The market continues to the south and west.

9718.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9606.name: Craft Street
description: This clutered side street is mostly ocupied by construction workers.
The new houses are being constructed on either side of the street.

9812.name: {BAbove {&[ {CDock --{MF{C-- {&]{B at {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: You stand on the dock. It extends out into the blue
Sea of Swords. Merchants, Captains, Sailors and all
diffrent types of people walk here. Crates float overhead
from large pulleys and onto the harbor road. People fish
off the end of the docks.

9854.name: Stairs onto the Ship
description: The plank ends here at a small stretch of stairs that carries the
final rise onto the ship.  The seabreeze is cool and crisp, and from
this vantage, the vast stretch of the Sea of Swords can be seen far to
the east--blue as far as the eye can see.  North steps onto the ship.

9588.name: Dark Passage
description: As you move east the wall to the west SLAMS shut behind you.
You seem to have stumbled into a small hand made passage.
The wall to the east doesn't look quite right.

9845.name: The {YG{yuild {8of the {CO{crder {8of the {wN{8ight{x
description: You are in a small gloomy room.  Torches bounce light off the walls
making it look errie.  A large desk sits at the back of the room, and
sitting behind the besk it looks to be the leader of the order of the
night.

9828.name: The {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x {c[ {CBefore Dock {MF {C]{x
description: You are out over deep water. The harbor of New Thalos lies
to the west. The large blue sea of The Sea of Swords lies to
the east.

9595.name: Zippoii's Room
description: Climbing up the staircase you enter the hovel of a curious mage. A small
uncomfortable looking bed rests in the corner, surrounded by ancient
tomes. On the worn desk next to the window candles burn low, casting
strange shadows on the walls. The only noticeable decor is the mounted
head of the Demi-Lich.

9525.name: West Main Street
description: A foreman stands stand here watching over two construction workers
fixing a pothole. The road here branches off north and south into
two alleys behind the stores of the market. The main street continues
east and west from here.

9779.name: Port Walk
description: The ramp upward levels to the high rise, wide walkway of Port Walk.
The timbers of this scaffold creak and sway from the impending winds,
as it brings a whirlwind of dust about the air.  From here, one can
gain a high vantage to the nearby lands: the looming mountains of the
north; the Ishtar River to the south, and beyond it a vast desert of
blinding yellow sands.  To the north, the private hangar section
spans, while down the platform, the walk connects back to the East
Main Street of New Thalos.

9663.name: Hall
description: You are at the eastern end of the southern hallway. A small servants'
entrance give access to the kitchen and the hall continues west.

9568.name: Alley
description: Even with your light you cannot seem to penetrate the magical cloak of
darkness covering this alley.

9744.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river widens here, no longer bounded by rock, and flows east
towards a plain.

9686.name: Guard Room
description: This is living quarters for the guards of the palace. Barren compared to
the rest of the palace, you see only cots and footlockers here. On the
walls you see pictures of well known knights who have given a proud name
to the Sultan's Guard.

9569.name: Alley
description: This is a tiny corner in the alley.  The temple walls are North and West.
You notice a fair amount of footprints to the east.
Kind of looks like a yeti has been here....  Hmmmm.

9859.name: {YP{yort {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RA{rirship {GF{gue{Gl {x& {CR{cepair {CS{chop{x
description: A large warehouse building opens up to show an airship fuel and
repair shop.  Across the floor are scattered airship parts, grease and
oil.  The air is thick with the smell of mechanics and makou fuel.
Tools and random parts are all over the place.

9581.name: Underground
description: The small passage heads north and east from here. You here the sounds
of the city above you.

9721.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river flows east and west through the hills. To the north you can
see a large volcano.

9605.name: By the Altar
description: You are by the temple altar in the northern end of Temple of New
Thalos. A huge altar made of highly polished black onyx is standing
in front of you. Behind this altar sits a twelve foot tall statue of
Loki, the highest god in all the lands.
Looking up the huge statue you see Loki calmly gazing out across his
lands.  He seems pleased.

9584.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The gentle flow of the river carries you eastward;  looking up you see
couples strolling along the road. To the west you see the southern
bridge and to the east you see the iron grating protecting the city from
unwanted guests.

9722.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river begins its decent out of the mountains now and continues
its flow to the east.

9518.name: Sultan's Walk
description: This cobblestone road aids your journey through town.  Traveling north
will take you by the palace and the Dancing Daemon Inn, and south will put
you on the market square.  You see the bank to the west.  To the east you
see {RWandering Bard Inn{x.

9510.name: Common Square
description: People pass by talking to each other, or rest their weary bones on this
grassy field. You can hear faint sounds of the river to the south of you
as it passes through the city. Ishtar drive heads east and west from here
and the medina is to the north. South lies the Ishtar River bridge and the
southern gate.
You see the bridge over the river.
You see the medina.

9582.name: Underground
description: The tunnel continues you west and east. Hopefully you have a good sense
of direction.

9710.name: Saska's Library
description: Fine, golden dust swirls and then settles as you enter Saska's
library. Leatherbound volumes of Shakespeare rest next to paperbacks by
Tom Robbins, and Toni Morrison's _Sula_ is open on the striking table: an
antique birdbath of polished blond wood, with glass set over the waterwell
to give the appearance of a perfectly still pool.  Trinkets, lightly
lifted from the mantles of the wealthy whose chimneys she cleaned, line
the windowsills and create space between the different sections of books.
A crystal oil lamp seems to float on the table; a piece of paper on the
wall, written in Saska's own lingering script, reads: "For what is your friend
that you would seek him with hours to kill?  Seek him always with hours to
live.  --Kahlil Gibran."
A cat purrs somewhere, though you cannot see the source, and you feel
yourself tugged into the softened space. Have a seat in one of the enormous
papasan chairs, and choose a title that strikes you.

9753.name: Ranger's Library
description: You walk through a doorway into a large library.  Here sits your
guildmaster ready to assist you when the time is right.  The room is
completely silent, save the breathing of the guildmaster, which is
soft and steady.  A door north leads back into the hunting lodge,
while a small corridor to the east leads to a darker room.

9521.name: Sultan's Walk
description: The main road north from the square continues here, surrounded by the walls
of the palace and the Daemon. To the north you see the heavily guarded gate
and can make out faint sounds of trade to the south.

9805.name: {RH{rarbor {GR{goad{x {&[ {CDock {ME {C---> {&]{x
description: You walk by some large caged crates, wild animals circle around
in them, looking for a way to rip you apart. A couple of sailors
sit here, guarding the cage with whips and daggers. A captain
yells to them for something.

9539.name: East Ishtar Drive
description: Small clumps of hay strewn about the ground alerts you to the fact that
you have reached the stables. Arabian stallions as well as many other
fine breeds of horses can be purchased for a price. Ishtar road continues
east and west.

9743.name: {BR{biver of {*L{bost {*S{bouls{x
description: The river makes a sharp bend here and heads east towards a large
mountain and north through a valley.

9543.name: Boat Ramp
description: This sloped slab of stone allows easy passage to and from the Ishtar.
Boats are moored to the docks here awaiting their masters to return from
the warehouses and the pubs. The waters of the Ishtar lap at your feet
to the south and Ishtar Drive is to the north.

9538.name: East Ishtar Drive
description: The wide road bordering the south of town continues to the east and
west here, bordered only by the hay-loft to the north and the Ishtar
River to the south.

9816.name: {BAbove {&[ {CDock --{MB{C-- {&]{B at {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: You stand on the dock. It extends out into the blue
Sea of Swords. Merchants, Captains, Sailors and all
diffrent types of people walk here. Crates float overhead
from large pulleys and onto the harbor road. People fish
off the end of the docks.

9680.name: Art Exhibit
description: You are standing in the Sultan's tribute to the finer virtues. Large
paintings hang from the walls displaying nature scenes, nudes, and
glorious victories in battle. Strange scupltures rest on pedestals
at each corner of the room and mirrors are placed in strategic
locations so the viewer may see an entire sculpture at a glance. Your
eyes, however, are pulled towards a painting that dominates the far wall.

9831.name: {CEast of the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: To the east the Sea of Swords stretches out all the way to the
horizon, far off the continent of Faerun.  To the west a large rock
wall stabs out from the dark blue waters of the Sea of Swords, the
ancient harbor wall of New Thalos.  Behind the protective wall lies
the harbor, filled with both ships of the sea, and ships of the air.

9839.name: Along The Shore
description: You are near the shore of New Thalos. The surf crashes up on dirt and
sand. Some creatures crawl around here, looking for something to eat.
The Sea of Swords lies to the east, land to the west.

9699.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9555.name: Kali Row
description: This is a small, newly added section of the town. The city's library
can be entered through the door to the west and The Casbah
begins it's journey a little ways north of here. The row and the
entrance to the dance hall is to the south.

9537.name: East Ishtar Drive
description: Loud hammering and the sound of red hot iron cooling in water reaches
your ears as you stand in front of the blacksmith. A small boy runs up
to you with big eyes and as you return his gaze runs off down the road.
The common square can be seen to the west and Ishtar Drive continues
to the east.

9748.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river flows east and west from here.

9659.name: North-West Tower
description: You stand on one of the four towers guarding the city. The view from here
is great! To the west you see the tall mountains that make up the divide
between here an Westbridge. The Ishtar river slowly flows from that direction.
South you can see the entire city of New Thalos and the Sands of Sorrow
to the south.

9657.name: Guard House
description: You stand inside the southern of the two main guard houses. The stone
interior has a spartan look to it, only the bare neccesities. A few
weapons are mounted on the walls in case they might be needed.

9560.name: Intersection: Port and Mason
description: The Port Walk intersects another walkway here called Mason.  There
are still remnants of construction as bundles of lumber lie all about.
The private hangars stand at either side of the street, while the Port
Walk continues north and south.

9766.name: Port Walk
description: The scaffold walk connects intersections here.  Through the spaces
between the timbers, one can see the ground below: a torn up street
that was once Guild Street.  A strong breeze kicks up a cloud of dust
and all around you the people shield their faces from the sands.  Port
Walk continues north and south from here.

9503.name: Medina
description: You stand on the Medina, on the larger open areas in New Thalos.
People walk to and fro carrying on their day to day business.  A bread
stand has been set up just west of here.  The Common Square of the
people opens up to the south and the Medina continues north.
You see medina.
You see the Common square.

9723.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river flows under the wall of the city to the east and stretches
off towards high snow capped mountains far far to the west.

9567.name: Alley
description: The darkness of this alley is almost supernatural.  Deep, black
darkness hints at the alley continuing west and south, while to the
east there is the hint of a doorway, and the sounds of people talking.

9655.name: Mason Street
description: This clutered side street is mostly occupied by construction workers.
The new houses are being constructed on either side of the street.

9609.name: Inside the Temple
description: Huge marble pillars rise on either side of you and grab hold of the ceiling.
Between each of these, fine softstone frescoes have been carved depicting
scenes from the religous history of New Thalos. Rows of pews face forward
giving their full attention to the pulpit rising high  above the ground. The
deep red carpeting underfoot shows not a speck of wear or dirt. It's obvious
that New Thalonians take religion seriously.

9617.name: Base of the Tower
description: You walk into a cold room whose only feature is an old wooden staircase
spirling up along the wall to a higher level. Up these stairs, you are
told, lies the old mage who may be able to help you advance in your
studies.

9814.name: {BAbove {&[ {CDock --{MD{C-- {&]{B at {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: You stand on the dock. It extends out into the blue
Sea of Swords. Merchants, Captains, Sailors and all
diffrent types of people walk here. Crates float overhead
from large pulleys and onto the harbor road. People fish
off the end of the docks.

9852.name: A {rCliff {xOverlooking the {BSea{x
description: You stand atop a short cliff that drops off to the sandy shores,
and further east lies the vast Sea of Swords.  The waters are deep
blue and sound as thundering horses across a path of stones.  This
rocky cliff has stood the impending waters for ages, as they have
carved the shores beneath.  Leaning tall and ancient over the shores
is an old tree, scarred and gnarled with what appears to be lightning
damage.

9825.name: {c[ {CDOCK {&--{ME{&-- {C] {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {RHa{rrb{Ror{x
description: A large stone dock cuts into the water from the stone coastline of
the Great Realms.  Above these stone docks lies the New Thalos Harbor,
one of the older harbors on the Eastern Shores.  The boats docked here
are mixed together, the ships of the sea with their brother, the ships
of the air.  A staircase leads upwards to the top of the docks and
into the harbor.
This is a safe haven for people and ships.

9684.name: Hall
description: This is the western end of the northern hallway. Two doors are set in the
walls here, one to the north, another to the west.

9571.name: Alley
description: You are in a tiny ally between the temple and Nabil's Exotic Animals. You hear
some shouting and general roadwork to the south.  The ground is rough and
in need of repair.  In the road is a small pothole.
Why are you looking in a pothole??????
You poor or something?

9548.name: Casbah
description: The cobblestone pavement runs along the north wall here. South of you
stand the great walls of the palace and the avenue goes east and west.

9725.name: {GI{cs{Gh{ct{Ga{cr {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues its descent down the lowlands flowing
ever so gently south. It's hard to believe this is the same river that
came cascading down the mountainside.

9619.name: Nectar of the Gods
description: You are startled by the lavishness of this place. From what you know of
clerics they are supposed to be humble people, giving all their
material goods to their cause. Perhaps because only clerics are
allowed to enter this bar they have condoned making it as comfortable
as possible. In the corner stands a staircase leading down to the
meditation chambers.

9687.name: Harem
description: This is the room where the Sultan keeps the beautiful women of his palace.
There are ten girls here lying about the room dressed in silks you can
almost see through. In the western end of the room stands a large mound
of pillows and a beautiful young maiden sits perched atop. It is
unfortunate for you that only the Sultan is allowed in here.

9626.name: Entrance to the Guild of Warriors'
description: This small hall is merely a check point to keep the unwanted out.

9799.name: Lair of the Ixitxachitl
description: Blood swirls around in the water as the Ixitxachitl devours the
last of its meal. Swirling around quickly as you intrude upon
its meal the large sting ray attacks!

9601.name: Underground
description: The small passage continues west and east.

9590.name: Dark Passage
description: The small passage continues west and east from here.
A huge boulder stands here. In its center someone has carved out a
perfect round hole.

9787.name: Sea Of Swords
description: The Sea Of Swords comes up along the shore here, the deep blue waters
rolling in and crashing against the beach. To the north you see a
small dock jutting out into the surf. You see the Harbor to the west
and the shipping lane going to it.

9780.name: {R<{r<{R- {*T{&he {ME{mast {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {*P{&ier {R-{r>{R>{x
description: You stand on a massive dock built of wooden timbers and iron,
acting as an actual extension of the New Thalos - Zozo Roadway
westwards.  The pier seems to have been here for quite a long time and
heavily used.  The Eastern portion of the pier stretches east into the
Sea of Swords, while another extension stretches northwards.
{x
{r[{RNorth{r] {*T{&he {RN{rorth {YN{yew {YT{yhalos {*P{&ier{x

9547.name: Casbah
description: As you travel down the road towards towards the city hall you look up
at the guards walking along the wall keeping watch. South of you stands
the great walls of the palace and the avenue goes east and west.

9810.name: Ship Building Area
description: You stand in a very large area. There are three bays here, each
containing a large frame of a ship. Each bay has a large sign
hanging from it, with the name of the ship that will be. One
reads "Titanic". The second read "Olympic" and the third reads
"The Dark Elf 2". The first one seems to be finished first from
the rest of them.

9635.name: Bread Stand
description: A small stand has been set up here, showing the shopkeep's humble
selection. You notice he has added a few things to his list.

9698.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9654.name: City Hall
description: You stand inside the administrative head of the city. Here the decisions
regarding city policy are made. Although the Sultan's word is law, he
usually spends his time on affairs outside the city wall.

9660.name: Guard House
description: You stand inside the northern of the two main guard houses. Strong
guards are seated here, playing cards. The stone interior is clean
but bare walled save the weapons and armor mounted in the walls.
The only exit is south.

9665.name: Hall
description: You have come to the eastern end of the northern hallway. The only exit
is west except for the simple wooden door to the north. There is a
golden plaque above the door.
The Holy Shrine of Allah
(remember Allah is a god, I wouldn't attack him)

9836.name: {CBefore the New Thalos Harbor {Bon {CT{Bhe {CS{Bea of {CS{Bwords{x
description: You are near the shore. The surf crashes against it with some force.
You see the Harbor of New Thalos to the north, and the river delta
to the south. The Sea of Swords lies to the east.

9727.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west meandering through the woods.

9625.name: Entrance to the Mage's Tower
description: The entrance hall is a small poorly lit room. It would seem its only
purpose is to house the powerful sorcerer standing here guarding
the entrance.

9703.name: Cell
description: You are in a cold, cramped chamber with only one exit.

9556.name: Kali Row
description: The short row ends abruptly here at the entrance to the dance hall
of New Thalos.  The entrance to the hall is to the west and the row
continues northward.  To the south stands a tiny castle, old and
showing of age, having stood here since before New Thalos was built.

9804.name: {RH{rarbor {GR{goad{x {&[ {CDock {MD {C---> {&]{x
description: You pass the scene of an acident. You see a group of sailors standing
around, looking at a very large crate. A pair of legs pop out from the
bottom of the crate, and blood slowly comes trickling out. Everyone
is silence.

9541.name: East Ishtar Drive
description: Your highly acute sense of smell reports you have reached the entrance
to the fish market. Although renowned for it fresh catches and
wide selection of aquarian delicacies you wonder how much longer you
can endure the smell! The Ishtar River flows alongside to the south
with the drive running alongside it east to west.

9763.name: {BOn The {CWe{cstbrid{Cge {BR{biver{x
description: The river continues east and west as it meanders through swampy forest.

9557.name: Underground
description: The small passage continues north and south.

9681.name: Guest Room
description: This is another room made up for visiting nobles. There is a dresser up
against the eastern wall with a mirror above it and a queen sized bed,
made up in satin sheets, against the south wall.

9603.name: Cleric's Sanctum
description: You walk down the staircase into the silent inner sanctum. Here sits
your guildmaster ready to assist you when the time is right. The room
is completely silent. The only obvious exit is back up the staircase
into the the Nectar.
You notice the floor at the base of the eastern wall has some faint
scratches in it.

9561.name: Intersection: Port and Craft
description: The Port Walk intersects another walkway here called Craft.  There
are still remnants of construction as bundles of lumber lie all about.
The private hangars stand at either side of the street, while the Port
Walk continues north and south.

9658.name: Lavish Walk of the Sultan's Palace
description: A lavish walkway begins here, leading west into a large palace
complex.  The streets are paved in marble, and the mortar seams are
filled with electrum alloy.  The palace to the west is breathtakingly
beautiful with tall, spiraling spires and brightly colored tiles
accenting every section of wall.  To the east is Sultan's Walk, while
the palace gates lie to the west.

9777.name: Casbah
description: The tall, stone walls of New Thalos rise to the north of the
Casbah.  To the south can be seen the lavish palace complex of the
Sultan.  The city guards frequent this walkway, though there still
feels a sense of danger, especially further west of here, were there
can be seen the start of a dark alleyway.  The Casbah continues east
and west.

9713.name: The New Thalos Courier
description: You enter the door, and note the large counter to the north of the
building.  Boxes are stacked neatly behind the counter, prepared for
delivery.  To the south part of the building are the desks of the men
and women who take care of the day-to-day business activities of this
service.
